description:
Block live migration unexpectedly fails when the vm to be migrated has some memory usage.

This error occurred to me with a Sahara cluster. The steps are:

1 - Create a cluster
2 - Migrating one VM of this idle cluster is ok
3 - Launch a wordcount job on the cluster
4 - From a given time of the job (where the ram is dirtier), trying to migrate this same VM fails.

My problem occurred with a specific job, but I think it may occur in any memory-bound process.
title: Block live migration fails when vm is being used

comments.content:
What is the mechanism of the failure?

When live migrating dirty pages are sent to the destination host, if the rate of dirtying of pages is high then the migration may take a long time or not complete at all. 

What type of failure are you seeing? A timeout? Do you have any logs?

There are a large number of configuration options that deal with live migration. Perhaps most importantly 'live_migration_completion_timeout' and 'live_migration_progress_timout' declare the maximum time to wait for a live migration before the operation is aborted.
